fact: DYK? Central banks around the world are major holders of gold, using it as a hedge against currency risk.
DYK? Brent Crude and WTI (West Texas Intermediate) are the two primary benchmark oils used for pricing.
DYK? Bitcoin's total supply is capped at 21 million, making it a deflationary asset by design.
DYK? The Indian stock market's two major indices are the BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty 50.
DYK? Gold is so malleable that a single ounce can be stretched into a wire over 50 miles long.
DYK? OPEC (Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries) controls about 40% of the world's crude oil supply.
DYK? The first real-world Bitcoin transaction was for two pizzas, worth about $41 in 2010. Today, that Bitcoin is worth millions.
DYK? The Indian rupee symbol (₹) was adopted in 2010, designed by D. Udaya Kumar.
DYK? All the gold ever mined in human history would fit into about three Olympic-sized swimming pools.
DYK? The 1973 oil crisis caused oil prices to quadruple, leading to global economic shocks.
DYK? Bitcoin mining consumes more electricity annually than some entire countries like Argentina.
DYK? India's GDP crossed $3 trillion in 2021, making it the 6th largest economy in the world.
DYK? Gold is chemically inert, which means it doesn't rust or corrode, making it perfect for jewelry and electronics.
DYK? The US Strategic Petroleum Reserve is the largest emergency oil storage in the world, with a capacity of 727 million barrels.
DYK? Bitcoin's blockchain technology makes transactions irreversible, preventing chargebacks.
DYK? The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) is Asia's oldest stock exchange, established in 1875.
DYK? Gold nanoparticles are used in modern medicine for drug delivery and cancer treatment.
DYK? Saudi Arabia has about 17% of the world's proven petroleum reserves, the largest of any country.
DYK? Bitcoin's pseudonymous creator, Satoshi Nakamoto, is estimated to own about 1 million BTC, untouched since 2010.
DYK? India is the world's second-largest consumer of gold, after China.
DYK? The gold standard, where currencies were backed by gold, was abandoned by most countries by the 1970s.
DYK? Venezuela has the largest proven oil reserves in the world, surpassing Saudi Arabia.

DYK? Fort Knox holds about 147 million ounces of gold, about half of the US Treasury's reserves.

DYK? Gold is so dense that one cubic foot weighs over half a ton.

DYK? India's IT sector contributes about 8% of the country's GDP and employs over 4 million people.

DYK? Bitcoin's decentralized nature means no single entity controls it, unlike traditional currencies.

DYK? The 1990 Gulf War caused oil prices to spike due to supply disruptions from the Middle East.

DYK? India's mutual fund industry has grown to over $500 billion in assets under management as of 2022.

DYK? India's forex reserves include gold, foreign currency assets, SDRs, and IMF reserve positions.

DYK? The Strait of Hormuz, between Oman and Iran, is the world's most important oil chokepoint, with 20% of global oil passing through.
DYK? Bitcoin's scarcity is mathematically enforced by its code, with new coins created at a predictable, decreasing rate.
DYK? India's banking sector is dominated by public sector banks, which hold about 60% of total banking assets.

DYK? Bitcoin's price is highly correlated with tech stocks like Tesla and MicroStrategy that hold BTC on their balance sheets.

DYK? Gold is the only metal that is yellow or golden in color naturally; other metals require alloying or treatment.

DYK? The Deepwater Horizon oil spill in 2010 released about 4.9 million barrels of oil into the Gulf of Mexico.

DYK? India's direct tax collections crossed ₹14 lakh crore for the first time in FY 2021-22.
DYK? Gold's atomic number is 79, making it one of the higher atomic number elements that occur naturally.

DYK? Bitcoin's dominance index measures its market cap relative to the total crypto market, typically between 40-60%.
DYK? India's fiscal deficit target for FY 2022-23 was set at 6.4% of GDP.

DYK? The 2022 Russia-Ukraine war caused Brent crude to surge above $130/barrel, the highest since 2008.
DYK? Bitcoin's UTXO (Unspent Transaction Output) model differs from traditional account-based systems used by banks.
DYK? India's public debt-to-GDP ratio is about 90%, higher than many emerging market peers.
DYK? Gold is non-toxic and biologically inert, which is why it's used in dental work and medical implants.
DYK? The US became a net petroleum exporter in 2020 for the first time since at least 1949.
DYK? Bitcoin's difficulty adjustment occurs every 2016 blocks (~2 weeks) to maintain a 10-minute block time.
DYK? India's current account deficit widened to 4.4% of GDP in Q2 2022, the highest in a decade.
DYK? The term 'carat' for gold purity comes from carob seeds, which were historically used as counterweights in balances.
